name: Ammonium carbamate
desc: Ammonium carbamate is the inorganic compound with the formula NH4[H2NCO2]. This salt formed by the reaction of ammonia with carbon dioxide. This compound is a white solid that is extremely soluble in water, less so in alcohol. It is unusual in degrading at room temperature.
[1]: ammonium aminoformate, carbamic acid ammoniate, carbamic acid ammonium salt, carbamic acid monoammonium salt[1]
Main hazards: Harmful if ingested, harmful to aquatic life, harmful if inhaled, respiatory tract irritation, skin irritation, eye irritation
